channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world

item.title: Ukraine says it hit a key fuel pipeline near Moscow that supplies Russian forces
item.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Ukrainian forces hit an important fuel pipeline in the Moscow region that supplies the Russian army, Ukraine's military intelligence said Saturday, a claim that came amid a sustained Russian campaign of massive drone and missile attacks on Ukraine’s energy infrastructure.
item.dc:creator: SAMYA KULLAB, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Israel says the latest remains returned from Gaza are not bodies of hostages
item.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — The remains of three people Hamas handed over to the Red Cross in Gaza do not belong to any hostages, Israel said Saturday, in the latest setback to the U.S.-brokered ceasefire in the Israel-Hamas war.
item.dc:creator: RENATA BRITO, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Pakistan partially reopens Torkham border crossing to allow Afghan refugees to leave
item.description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan (AP) — Pakistan on Saturday partially reopened the Torkham border crossing with Afghanistan to allow thousands of stranded Afghan refugees to return home, officials said. Restrictions remain on all other cross-border movement, including trade.
item.dc:creator: RIAZ KHAN, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Top diplomats from Germany, Jordan and the UK call for an immediate ceasefire in Sudan war
item.description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — The foreign ministers of Germany, Jordan and the United Kingdom jointly called on Saturday for an immediate ceasefire in the war in Sudan, describing the situation there in stark, apocalyptic terms after a paramilitary force seized the last major city in the East A
item.dc:creator: JON GAMBRELL, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: US national intelligence director says former American strategy of 'regime change' is over
item.description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — The U.S. national intelligence director told officials Friday in the Mideast that America’s former strategy of “regime change or nation building” had ended under President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: JON GAMBRELL, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Pentagon says Ukraine can have Tomahawk missiles: Report
item.description: The Pentagon has given approval to the White House to send long-range Tomahawk missiles to Ukraine, potentially fulfilling President Volodymyr Zelensky's desire for more weapons in his country's war with Russia if President Trump provides the final green light, CNN reported Friday.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Mancini, The Hill

item.title: Unidentified remains of 3 people transferred to Israel, Red Cross says
item.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — The Red Cross said it transferred the unidentified remains of three people to Israel late Friday but they were still being examined and may not be those of missing hostages, an Israeli military official said.
item.dc:creator: WAFAA SHURAFA and JULIA FRANKEL, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Protesters call for governor’s resignation after Rio’s deadliest police raid
item.description: RIO DE JANEIRO (AP) — Hundreds of protesters on Friday marched through one of the favelas targeted in Rio de Janeiro's most lethal police raid that left more than 100 dead, calling for Rio state Gov. Cláudio Castro to resign amid continued outrage over the deadly operation.
item.dc:creator: ELÉONORE HUGHES, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Israel's military prosecutor admits she leaked video of soldiers assaulting a Palestinian detainee
item.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — Israel’s top military prosecutor resigned Friday, admitting she was responsible for leaking a video showing soldiers assaulting a Palestinian detainee at a notorious military detention center, according to excerpts of the letter published by Israeli media.
item.dc:creator: JULIA FRANKEL, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Prince Andrew moves to Sandringham
item.description: Unlike other properties that the royal family inhabits through the Crown Estate, Sandringham is privately owned by the king.
item.dc:creator: Teddy Grant, NewsNation

item.title: Yemen will put captured UN staff on trial
item.description: Yemen says UN workers helped Israel with airstrikes, and will put UN employees on trial. 36 UN staffers were arrested in Yemen.
item.dc:creator: Abdulrhman Al-Ansi and Khaled Abdullah, NewsNation

item.title: Venezuela's Peace Prize-winning opposition leader backs Trump's boat strikes
item.description: Nobel Peace Prize winner María Corina Machado said she backs President Trump’s boat strikes in the Caribbean Sea, placing blame for deaths from U.S. airstrikes squarely on the shoulders of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro.
item.dc:creator: Surina Venkat, The Hill

item.title: New inquest rules South African Nobel laureate Albert Luthuli was beaten to death in 1967
item.description: CAPE TOWN, South Africa (AP) — A new inquest into the 1967 death of South African Nobel Peace Prize winner and anti-apartheid leader Albert Luthuli has found that he was beaten to death, and it rejected a previous finding that he died as a result of being hit by a train.
item.dc:creator: GERALD IMRAY, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Rio favelas left reeling after lethal gang raid as families bury the dead
item.description: RIO DE JANEIRO (AP) — Families of the scores of people killed in a deadly gang raid by Rio de Janeiro police began burying the dead on Thursday, with residents left reeling by the scenes of carnage and livid at law enforcement whom they accuse of excessive force, torture and extrajudicial killings.
item.dc:creator: ELÉONORE HUGHES, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Haiti, Jamaica and Cuba pick up the pieces after Melissa's destruction
item.description: SANTIAGO DE CUBA, Cuba (AP) — The rumble of large machinery, whine of chain saws and chopping of machetes echoed through communities across the northern Caribbean on Thursday as they dug out from the destruction of Hurricane Melissa and surveyed the damage left behind.
item.dc:creator: ARIEL FERNÁNDEZ, ANDREA RODRÍGUEZ and JOHN MYERS JR., Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Prince Andrew dragged out negotiations before banishment for cash: Source
item.description: Asked if there was a “number” Andrew had in mind, the source said, “I think a couple of million would go a long way.
item.dc:creator: Paula Froelich, NewsNation

item.title: 5 more arrests as Louvre jewel heist probe deepens and key details emerge
item.description: PARIS (AP) — The dragnet tightened around the Louvre thieves on Thursday. Five more people were seized in the crown-jewels heist — including a suspect tied by DNA — the Paris prosecutor said, widening the sweep across the capital and its suburbs.
item.dc:creator: THOMAS ADAMSON and ANGELA CHARLTON, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: 5 deals Trump, Xi struck in South Korea
item.description: President Trump emerged from his meeting with Chinese President Xi Jinping on Thursday touting agreements on tariffs, rare earth exports and soybean purchases as the two superpowers reached truces on key issues.
item.dc:creator: Brett Samuels, The Hill

item.title: Trump, Xi agree to ease trade war in high-stakes meeting
item.description: President Donald Trump announced an agreement with Chinese President Xi Jinping to ease their trade war following a meeting Thursday, with the U.S. scaling back tariffs and China delaying export controls and resuming some soybean purchases.
item.dc:creator: Julia Manchester, WGN 9

item.title: Hegseth says military conducted another strike on boat carrying alleged narco-terrorists
item.description: The U.S. military targeted another alleged narco-trafficking boat, sparking congressional concerns over due process and legal authority for the deadly strikes.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: 80-year-old Australian woman dies on island after cruise ship leaves without her
item.description: An 80-year-old Australian woman was found dead after the Coral Adventurer cruise ship allegedly left her behind on Lizard Island during a hiking tour.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Prince Andrew hosted Epstein, Maxwell at Royal Lodge: Reports
item.description: Prince Andrew recently gave up his royal title amid ongoing scrutiny over his association with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.
item.dc:creator: Steph Whiteside, NewsNation

item.title: Israel's military says ceasefire is back on after heavy airstrikes on Gaza
item.description: The strikes — the deadliest since the ceasefire was enacted on Oct. 10 — marked the most serious challenge to the tenuous truce to date.
item.dc:creator: WAFAA SHURAFA and JOSH BOAK, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Venezuela suspends energy deals with Trinidad after arrival of US warship
item.description: Trinidad is hosting one of the U.S. warships involved in a controversial campaign to destroy Venezuelan boats allegedly carrying drugs.
item.dc:creator: JORGE RUEDA, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Half of uncontacted Indigenous groups could be gone in decade: Report
item.description: "These are what I would call silent genocides — there are no TV crews, no journalists," said Survival International's Fiona Watson.
item.dc:creator: Rob Taub, NewsNation
